tasks.task: Drive a skid loaders
subtasks: Sit on the skid loader seat
Operate the skid loader controls
Drive the skid loader around the field
Attach a front attachment to the skid loader
Use the skid loader to move material

tasks.task: Lift hay onto a trailer
subtasks: Inspect the hay for quality
Determine the trailer load capacity
Select appropriate hay to load
Maneuver the hay bales onto the trailer
Secure the hay bales on the trailer to prevent shifting

tasks.task: Use a front loader to stack hay bales
subtasks: Approach the hay bales with the front loader
Lift a hay bale using the front loader
Transport the hay bale to the designated stacking area
Align the hay bale with the previous stacks
Release the hay bale to stack it on top
Repeat the process until all hay bales are stacked

tasks.task: Load a skid loader with hay bales
subtasks: Locate hay bales near the skid loader
Lift a hay bale onto the skid loader
Repeat until the skid loader is loaded
Drive the skid loader to the packing area
Position the skid loader close to the packing machine
Lower the hay bales onto the packing machine

tasks.task: Drive a skid loader
subtasks: Sit on the skid loader seat
Operate the skid loader controls (likely including steering, bucket elevation, directional movement)
Transport the skid loader between different locations (e.g., fields, stacking area, packing machine)

tasks.task: Attach a front attachment to the skid loader
subtasks: Couple the front attachment (possible like forks or a bale grab) to the skid loader's mounting points
Secure the attachment to ensure it does not come loose during operation

tasks.task: Move hay bales onto a trailer
subtasks: Position the skid loader underneath a hay bale
Use the bucket to lift the hay bale safely
Bring the bale to the trailer
Arrange the bale on the trailer for secure stacking

tasks.task: Stack hay bales
subtasks: Elevate a hay bale using the skid loader
Identify the correct position relative to existing stack layers
Place the hay bale accurately to maintain stability
Repeat with successive bales, ensuring each layer is offset (crane stacking technique)

tasks.task: Secure the hay bales on a trailer
subtasks: Using a tie-down system or other securing method to fix the bales in place
Inspect the secured bales to ensure no shifting will occur during transport

tasks.task: Inspect the hay's quality
subtasks: Check for visual signs of damage, discoloration, or spoilage
Assess the bale's density and moisture content if possible

tasks.task: Determine the trailer's load capacity
subtasks: Measure or estimate the volume and/or weight of hay that can fit safely
Compare the available space with the hay’s size to avoid overloading the trailer

tasks.task: Drive a Skid Loader (used for moving hay bales)
subtasks: Sit on the skid loader seat.
Operate the skid loader controls to move around.
Use the skid loader bucket to pick up a hay bale.
Lift the hay bale vertically with the bucket.
Drive the skid loader to transport the bale to the stacking area.
Place the hay bale down at the stacking area.

tasks.task: Stack Hay Bales
subtasks: Choose the correct position relative to the existing stack.
Elevate the hay bale with the skid loader.
Align it properly with the previous bales.
Lower the bale onto the stack.

tasks.task: Load Hay Bales onto a Trailer Using a Skid Loader
subtasks: Position the skid loader under the bale.
Lift the bale onto the trailer.
Align it on the trailer for stacking.
Repeat until the trailer is full.
